title: Rome
subTitle: Rome - Starting City
desc: Rome, the Eternal City. Might of the Great Empire. The seat of emperors and popes.

title: Roman Fort
subTitle: Rome - Starting Fort
desc: Wooden forts are quick to build and provide enough protection to disuade enemy raids.

title: Etruscan Country Side
subTitle: Rome - Starting Land
desc: The mild medditeranean climate of the etruscan country side provided rome with many supplies.

title: Uruk
subTitle: Sumerian - Starting City
desc: The first city; the birth of civilization; wrapped in myth, draped in the first glories of man.

title: The First Walls
subTitle: Sumerian - Starting Fort
desc: Sumeria is home to the first cities ever constructed. From their prehistorical origins these cities requires high walls to protect their inhabitants.

title: The Fertile Cresent
subTitle: Sumerian - Starting Land
desc: The unpredictable Tigris and Euphrates rivers can cause havoc, but also drive inventive cultivation methods.

title: Forges
desc: Forges increase the rate of production of weapons and armor; making it easier to deploy larger and better equiped armies.

title: Paving
desc: Paving made for longer lasting city roads that could impress even the richest foreign diplomats.

title: Toll roads
desc: Toll roads increased the revenue of the state, allowing them to profit off of the mercentile exchange of it's people.

title: Codex
desc: The codex eventually replaced the scroll as the default writing format. It allowed for easier access to the middle and end of the document.

title: Spearmen
desc: Spearmen are defensive troops that can withstand a lot of damage and are easy to recruit.
